pullRequest.body:
In this PR, I weaken some assumptions so that they can be applied more widely (more specifically, to my use case :) ) I also renamed some lemmas because they sounded weird.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [908a54e73f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16015/commits/908a54e73f2db254d86893d4bd06366352a6b6f7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsZeroAtImInfty.isBoundedAtImInfty`
`+ _root_.bounded_mem`
`+ _root_.zero_at_im_infty`
`+ isBoundedAtImInfty_iff`
`+ isZeroAtImInfty_iff`
`- IsBoundedAtImInfty.mul`
`- bounded_mem`
`- zero_at_im_infty`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|5088|-1|porting notes|

Current commit [908a54e73f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/908a54e73f2db254d86893d4bd06366352a6b6f7)
Reference commit [29f545b811](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/29f545b8110e796db8de688fa9e3950ce95cf678)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Also, what is the reason that `CuspForm` doesn't extend from `ModularForm`? I know the zero_at_infty'` and `bdd_at_infty'` properties duplicate but having CuspForm inherit ModularForm should reduce some code duplication.

> Also, what is the reason that `CuspForm` doesn't extend from `ModularForm`? I know the zero_at_infty'`and`bdd_at_infty'` properties duplicate but having CuspForm inherit ModularForm should reduce some code duplication.

I think that that duplication is one of the reasons why its not an extends. The reason for having the class versions of the definitions is to solve this code duplication.
When renaming existing results, please add a deprecated alias. (If you start typing "deprecated" in vs code, it should suggest an autocompletion.)
Hope I'm doing this right, I'm using the neovim plugin for lean and it doesn't seem to show any code action for deprecation, but I copied the code from other parts of Mathlib.
Hi, bump. Can someone review this?
LGTM!  but you should fix the build failure!
Oops, I saw the LGTM part in my email inbox but not the "fix build error" part. This should do it.
The CI run is failing because of a non-backwards-compatible change to the "post PR summary comment" script â€“ could you please merge the latest master? That should cure it.
Hopefully this makes things pass :)

LGTM now. One last thing: can you create an issue on GitHub for generalising the asymptotics API to drop commutative assumptions, and quote the issue number in the TODO comment in the code? 

maintainer delegate
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: grhkm21 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11935074933/job/33265602870)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11935074933/job/33265602368)

I left some further comments. 

I think it's a good compromise to only modify the general asymptotics lemmas that you specifically need, and leave the general problem of removing commutativity elsewhere in the theory for a later PR.

I left some further comments. 

I think it's a good compromise to only modify the general asymptotics lemmas that you specifically need, and leave the general problem of removing commutativity elsewhere in the theory for a later PR.
By the way, I don't know if making such small changes qualify as a co-author, and I'm happy to remove this.

I usually wouldnt for something this small (otherwise every file would have Yael's name as an author lol). But I dont know what the rules are about this, I essentially would never do it unless substantially changed/expanded the file.
do we need these given we have: `BoundedAtFilter.add` etc?
That was my question too, I added them because I saw `IsBoundedAtImInfty.add` but not the others I added. I will just remove all three then
this (and the others) looks like an old lean 3 name that got forgotten in the port.
I dont thik we should need this since we have `instance (priority := 99) [FunLike F â„ â„‚] [CuspFormClass F Î“ k] : ModularFormClass F Î“ k where` further down the file.
I see, I never looked too closely at the `Class` things, but I should. I've also removed this then

Then wouldn't it be better to weaken the assumptions in the general library lemma, rather than doing it in this special case only? (I assume you are referring to the assumption `SeminormedAddGroup` rather than `NormedAddGroup`.)

(the proof is a one-liner, just do
```
theorem ZeroAtFilter.boundedAtFilter [SeminormedAddCommGroup Î²] {l : Filter Î±} {f : Î± â†’ Î²}
    (hf : ZeroAtFilter l f) : BoundedAtFilter l f := 
  ((Asymptotics.isLittleO_one_iff _ ).mpr hf).isBigO
```
at line 74 of `ZeroAndBoundedAtFilter.lean`.)

Okay I *tried* weakning the assumptions of the general library lemma, but that will of course require also modifying the assumptions of the adjacent lemmas (or actually the entire section, at least those that can be weakened - which is majority actually), and it kind of has a cascading effect with 500+ lines of diff. I don't think it's appropriate for this PR. I will use your one-liner.

I donâ€™t follow. The other surrounding lemmas in the filter API all work for seminorms, itâ€™s literally only this one which currently requires a norm; so the fix should definitely be one line, not 500. I am away from my computer now, but I can look at this this evening.

Looking at this again: I had overlooked that you wanted to remove the **commutativity** assumption on `Î±`, not just to weaken from "norm" to "seminorm". This is going to be much more difficult, and I am very curious now what your intended application is. 

(My impression is that you can't do very much with a non-commutative (semi)normed group;Â in particular, you need commutativity in order for the norm to induce a topological-group structure.)

I looked at that and thought, "why change the dot-notation back to the clumsier older notation"? On checking out the code and playing with it, I realised that the deprecated alias `IsBoundedAtImInfty.mul` is "masking" the more general lemma `BoundedAtFilter.mul` so it doesn't get found by namespace search. This, to me, seems like a good reason _not_ to add a deprecation for the old lemma. Then this proof can become simply
```lean
  bdd_at_infty' A := by simpa only [coe_mul, mul_slash_SL2] 
    using (f.bdd_at_infty' A).mul (g.bdd_at_infty' A)
```
I am unable to get your code working even after un-deprecating the alias, so I tried an alternative, see if it's okay.
I tried it out before posting it, so it definitely does work.

I just tried it again, and it works fine (after removing the section `BasicOperations` in the other file which you have subsequently added). 

Perhaps it was not clear from my old message that I meant "remove `IsBoundedAtImInfty.mul` and don't deprecate it", not "leave the lemma there and don't deprecate it".

Defining this variable at the top of the file, and then using it just once 1000 lines further down, perhaps isn't ideal. I'm also not keen on the proliferation of `'` marks since they get carried over to the tooltip display and ref-manual entry for any lemma using them. Perhaps it would be better to declare a new `f` in the statement of the lemma.

These should all be lemmas, not defs. But, more importantly, I'm not convinced we need them at all. `IsBoundedAtImInfty` is only supposed to be a very thin wrapper around `IsBoundedAtFilter`; I don't think we should go overboard adding lots of API for it. (I would personally argue for removing `IsBoundedAtImInfty` and `IsZeroAtImInfty` entirely, and just writing `IsBoundedAtFilter atImInfty` etc ,but that is clearly not relevant to this PR.)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(UpperHalfPlane): weaken assumptions of multiple atImInfty lemmas
